# idcloudhost_floating_ip (Resource)
Floating Public IPv4 address

## Example Usage
```
resource "idcloudhost_floating_ip" "testip" {
    name = "my_test_ip"
    billing_account_id = 1200132376
    assigned_to = idcloudhost_vm.instance_a.id
}

resource "idcloudhost_vm" "instance_a" {
    name = "instanceA"
    os_name = "ubuntu"
    os_version= "18.04"
    disks = 20
    vcpu = 1
    memory = 1024
    username = "example"
    initial_password = "Password123"
    billing_account_id = 1337
    backup = false
}

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Argument Reference
The following arguments are supported:

- `billing_account_id` - (Required) Billing account ID associated with the authentication token.
- `name` - (Required) Name of this IP address.
- `assigned_to` - (Optional) Virtual Machine UUID to bind this IP address to.
- `timeouts`- (Block, Optional) (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--timeouts))

## Attribute Reference
Additionally, the following computed attributes are exported:

- `address` - valid public IPv4 address.
- `created_at` - resource creation timestamp.
- `enabled` - is the IP address enabled, automatically assigned true by idCloudHost.
- `id` - the ID of this resource.
- `network_id` - automatically generated by idCloudHost.
- `type` - automatically generated by idCloudHost.
- `updated_at` - last updated timestamp.
- `user_id` - the user ID.

<a id="nestedblock--timeouts"></a>
### Nested Schema for `timeouts`

Optional:

- `create` (String) - default `1` minute
